description: Number of solutions to sigma(x) = n!.
references: R. K. Guy (1981): Unsolved Problems In Number Theory, B39.
links: Max A. Alekseyev, Computing the (number or sum of) inverses of Euler's totient and other multiplicative functions, arXiv:1401.6054 [cs.DM], 2014.
example: For n = 9, solutions to sigma(x) = n! = 362880 form a set {97440, ..., 361657} of size 382, so a(9) = 382.
maple: with(numtheory): for f from 1 to 9 do fac := f!: k := 0:for n from 1 to fac do if sigma(n)=fac then k := k+1: fi: od: print( k); od:
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 28 2000
